Preterit.text: 44. Qbiḏole (=ḥḏinole) qəm ṣadre, i+kefayo. Kəmmi faširo hul dbaxi. Nafəq henuḳa me bəṯr u+šuro, məḷḷe, ‘Yabo, kalí’.
He clasped it to his breast, that stone. They say it melted until he cried. At that moment he came out from behind the wall, he said, ‘Dad, here I am’. (Story of Joseph)

Infectum.text: Koqobaḏḏe qəm ṣadre nošaqqe. He claspes them to his breast and kisses them.
